page.title: 02CHILLENDEN,ROWLING,KNOWLTON
page.content: Chillenden is little more than a ham_ let. There is a farriers workshop, a village hall, Kemps Coach depot the village church, a rather dirty duck_ pond which doubles as a drainage sump of the road in rainy weather. The Griffins Head is the local pub. The housing is a mixture of several styles and different periods. There are two small, newly built areas one of expen_ sive detached housing overlooking the village; the other set in the valley bottom and made up of medium period detached houses. The remaining houses are of different periods. Close by is Rowling hamlet. It is mainly used by holiday makers in the summer and some students in winter. It is owned by the Fox Pitt family of Knowlton. It has few permanent residents.
